WRITING.TEXT: You can always just get a [vapesafe fuse](http://www.litecigusa.net/Smoktech-VapeSafe-Fuse-p/smok-fuse.htm)

Eventually you'll break it in. Some people put straight vg on there as lube. I had a veritas clone top that would not come off so I ended up taking off one of the O rings.
If you take off an o ring make sure u have a spare, because if it breaks and it ends up too loose you're screwed.

There is mother 1, 2, and 3 for the nes, snes, and gba in that order. Those are Japanese though, the only official English release we got was Earthbound, which is mother 2.
You should start at Earthbound for the Snes, yes the games are linked together but you don't have to beat one to understand the others.
The easiest way to get Earthbound would probably be to buy it on the wiiU on the eshop or get an emulator on ur pc.

Well it depends how comfortable you are building the RDA itself, [here's a dual coil build that looks pretty good](http://www.steam-engine.org/coil.asp?s=dp r=0.6 hfnw=50 awg=28 id=2.5)
dual coil, 6 wraps per coil(2.5mm drill bit) with 28 gauge = about .6ohms That ramp time doesn't look too bad @50 watts but if you want better you can try 5 wraps per coil.
The Istick will fire at .5 right? I only use mech mods so I don't really know the limits for those devices.

The atty's the others described are good. What's going to help get you clouds is coil surface area, try to get a good amount of wraps in there but not so much that it will take a long time to heat up(ramp time). Also the air flow is really important, it has to be lined up right with the coil(s). I'd recommend 26-28 gauge if ur max is 50 watts.
You generally want something that will give you as much surface area as possible but not too much that will cause a large ramp up time.

It's got explosions, robots, zombies, and pizza so why not. The story is incredible, the game is pretty damn interesting from the very beginning.
Here's something fun to do if you never played it. Watch the intro, the part that looks like a TV with a lot of **red** static, but don't watch the rest after that. Let that image sink in your mind and then start the game.
*What comes after that in the intro is just a video preview of random parts of the game so it's kinda like a spoiler... Don't watch that yet..*

What happens after such a "big crunch" is speculation at best.

I have a older lenovo with an early gen. I7 probably around $600 right now. The problem with cheap laptops is that they are not good for netplay, I only use my laptop for when I go to parties where I play offline with friends or where a PC/Wii just isn't possible.
Project M is competitive, there is going to be a bit of screen lag, dropped frames once in a while, and maybe over heating if your son can't take care of his laptop properly. This is what you get if you buy a cheaper laptop.
Not to mention your son will be ridiculed for bringing a laggy setup if he takes it to a competitive get-together.
It's like bringing melee with a flatscreen monitor.

Ex freelancer.com graphic artist here. I started there as a beginner doing only logo contest entries for about a year. I tried to withdraw my prize winnings for all the contests I've won for the first time about a month ago and I'm still waiting, there is a waiting period but it's way past that and I still haven't been contacted back about it.
I have to agree with everything that your blog post says, and also add that almost every single contest WINNER is a stolen design from various stock image websites.
